page.title: 14THAMESIDE THEATRE, GRAYS
page.content: The Thameside Theatre in Grays is in fact a library,history museum, cinema and theatre all in one building. The original site was established in 1911 as a history museum and a library, but in 1968 it was decided that Grays needed something bigger and better. The present building cost Â£920,000 and was completed in 1971. Three main floors are open to the public and the attractions include an adult lending library, childrens library,booking office for forthcoming attractions,art display area,record and cassette lending library, teachers resource centre, local history museum,reference library, periodical rooms,study rooms,toilets,two theatres for plays,shows,lectures or films, and a licenced bar. Recently the system of date stamping borrowed items has been phased out and bar coding introduced.
